text: Cysteine (abbreviated as Cys or C)Nomenclature and symbolism for amino acids and peptides (IUPAC-IUB Recommendations 1983). Pure Appl. Chem. 56 (5), 1984: 595–624. is an α-amino acid. It has the chemical formula HO2CCH(NH2)CH2SH. Cysteine is a semi-essential amino acid, which means that humans can make it. The codons UGU and UGC code for cysteine. The thiol side chain in cysteine often does enzyme reactions as a nucleophile. The thiol oxidises to give the disulfide derivative cystine, which is important in many protein structures. When used as a food additive, cysteine has the E number E920. == References == Category:Amino acids
title: Cysteine
